title: Contributing to understress
text: outlines propose change understress. detailed info contributing , tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide.

title: Contributing to understress
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to understress
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to understress
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("Reckziegel/understress", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to understress
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to understress
text: Please note understress project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

what: Stress-Test the Generalized Hyperbolic Distribution — stress_test_univariate_ghyp_distribution
title: Stress-Test the Generalized Hyperbolic Distribution — stress_test_univariate_ghyp_distribution
text: function implements stress-test GHD stretching one parameters (mean, sigma skewness) 20 percent directions (). , analyses impact shaked parameter causes parameters.

title: Stress-Test the Generalized Hyperbolic Distribution — stress_test_univariate_ghyp_distribution
code: stress_test_univariate_ghyp_distribution(   .invariant,   .what = c("mu", "sigma", "skew"),   .simulations = 300,   .symmetric = FALSE )  # S3 method for default stress_test_univariate_ghyp_distribution(   .invariant,   .what = c("mu", "sigma", "skew"),   .simulations = 300,   .symmetric = FALSE )  # S3 method for tbl stress_test_univariate_ghyp_distribution(   .invariant,   .what = c("mu", "sigma", "skew"),   .simulations = 300,   .symmetric = FALSE )  # S3 method for xts stress_test_univariate_ghyp_distribution(   .invariant,   .what = c("mu", "sigma", "skew"),   .simulations = 300,   .symmetric = FALSE )  # S3 method for matrix stress_test_univariate_ghyp_distribution(   .invariant,   .what = c("mu", "sigma", "skew"),   .simulations = 300,   .symmetric = FALSE )  # S3 method for numeric stress_test_univariate_ghyp_distribution(   .invariant,   .what = c("mu", "sigma", "skew"),   .simulations = 300,   .symmetric = FALSE )

title: Stress-Test the Generalized Hyperbolic Distribution — stress_test_univariate_ghyp_distribution
text: .invariant univariate data structure. .character indicating parameter stressed. .simulations numeric scalar. number simulations executed level correlation. .symmetric character flag. distributions symmetric? Default FALSE.
